accessories.message_must_use_insecure_mo: To control your accessories you must be running Homebridge in insecure mode.
accessories.message_rooms_not_appear_in_: The rooms you create here will not appear in HomeKit, they are only for the organisation of accessories in the Homebridge UI.
backup.message_backup_help_one: Download a backup archive of your entire Homebridge environment. This will backup the entire contents of your Homebridge storage directory which you can later restore on any platform capable of running the Homebridge UI.
backup.message_backup_help_two: Plugins not hosted on npm, or plugins installed directly from GitHub will not be backed up or restored.
backup.message_backup_warning: Backup archives contain sensitive information and should not be shared with others.
backup.message_restore_help_one: Restore a backup archive you previously made using the Homebridge UI. Your Homebridge config, cached accessories, HomeKit pairings and Homebridge UI user accounts will be restored. Any Homebridge plugins you had installed will also be downloaded from the npm registry.
backup.message_restore_help_two: You will need to login to the Homebridge UI using the credentials from the restored instance after doing a restore.
backup.message_restore_warning: Restoring from a backup will irreversibly overwrite the current Homebridge configuration.
backup.message_scheduled_backup_none_yet: No scheduled backups have been created yet. The next automated backup is scheduled to be taken at {{ backupTime }} server time.
backup.message_scheduled_backup_time: A full backup of the Homebridge instance is automatically created every day at {{ backupTime }} and kept for {{ dayCount }} days.
child_bridge.message_about: Homebridge allows you to run your plugin's platform or accessory as an isolated child bridge. This can improve the general responsiveness and reliability of Homebridge.
child_bridge.message_child_bridges_must_: Each child bridge platform or accessory will need to be paired with HomeKit separately.
child_bridge.message_must_configure_plug: You need to configure this plugin before you can manage its bridge settings.
child_bridge.message_restart_homebridge: Restart Homebridge to finish setting up this child bridge.
child_bridge.message_return_to_pair: Return to this screen after Homebridge has restarted to view the pairing QR code.
child_bridge.message_select_platforms_ac: Select which platforms or accessories you want to run as a child bridge
config.toast_click_save_to_confirm_backu: Click Save to confirm you want to restore this backup.
config.toast_config_username_format_erro: Bridge username must be 6 pairs of colon-separated hexadecimal characters (A-F 0-9)
login.message_invalid_2fa_code: The code entered is incorrect or has expired.
logs.message_download_warning: Homebridge log files may contain personal information, passwords or access tokens. Please review the log file and remove any sensitive information before sharing with others.
logs.message_truncate_log_warning: This action will irreversibly delete your existing Homebridge logs. Are you sure you want to continue?
menu.hbrestart.confirmation: Are you sure you want to restart Homebridge?
menu.hbrestart.title: Restart Homebridge
menu.restart.title: Power Options
platform.docker.restart_container.messag: Make sure you're running the Docker container with --restart=always
Server restart is taking a long time. You may need to bring up the Docker container manually.
platform.docker.startup_script.message_s: This script will be executed each time the docker container starts. You can use this to install any extra packages your plugins may need such as ffmpeg or libpcap-dev.
platform.docker.startup_script.toast_res: You will need to restart this docker container for the changes to take effect.
platform.linux.restart.confirmation: Are you sure you want to reboot your operating system?
platform.linux.restart.message_please_wa: Please wait, this page will automatically redirect when the Homebridge is back online.
platform.linux.restart.message_server_ta: Server restart is taking a long time. You may need to bring up the server back up manually.
platform.linux.restart.toast_server_rest: An error occurred sending the restart command to the server
platform.linux.restart.toast_server_taki: The server is taking a long time to come back online
platform.linux.shutdown.confirmation: Are you sure you want to shutdown your operating system?
platform.linux.shutdown.message_server_w: The server will power down shortly.
platform.version.message_service_restart: Homebridge UI v{{ uiVersion }} has been installed, but the server service is still running v{{ serverVersion }}.
plugins.donate.message_learn_more: Learn more about donation links on plugins
plugins.manage.child_bridge_restart_fail: Plugin restart failed, please restart Homebridge manually.
plugins.manage.label_online_updates_not_: Online updates are not supported on Windows. You will need to upgrade Homebridge manually after stopping the Homebridge service.
plugins.manage.message_confirm_disable: Are you sure you want to disable {{ pluginName }}? Any accessories exposed by this plugin will be removed from HomeKit.
plugins.manage.message_confirm_enable: Are you sure you want to enable {{ pluginName }}?
plugins.manage.message_thanks_for_updati: Thanks for installing the {{ targetVersion }} version of {{ pluginName }}.
Please restart Homebridge for the changes to apply.
Please restart the plugin's child bridges for the changes to apply.
plugins.manage.message_uninstall_remove_: If you are permanently removing this plugin, make sure you remove any config for this plugin in the config.json before restarting Homebridge.
Are you sure you want to uninstall {{ pluginName }}?
plugins.manage.modal_verified_message: Homebridge plugins that are marked as verified have been reviewed by the Homebridge project team to ensure they meet various requirements that encourage best practices and a trouble-free user experience.
plugins.node_update.are_you_sure_you_wan: Are you sure you want to update {{ pluginName }}?
plugins.node_update.homebridge_node_vers: Homebridge v{{latestVersion}} requires Node.js v{{minVersion}} or later. You are currently running Node.js {{ installedVersion }}.
plugins.node_update.node_version_too_low: The {{ pluginName }} plugin recommends running on Node.js v{{ minVersion }} or later. You are currently running Node.js {{ installedVersion }}.
plugins.node_update.title: Node.js Version
plugins.node_update_homebridge_ui_upgrad: Please upgrade Node.js before updating Homebridge UI.
plugins.node_update_homebridge_upgrade_a: Please upgrade Node.js before updating Homebridge.
plugins.placeholder_search_first: Use the search bar above to find your first plugin
plugins.settings.custom.homebridge-gsh.m: The Homebridge Google Smart Home plugin allows you to control your Homebridge accessories from a Google Home enabled smart speaker or the Google Home mobile app.
To enable this functionality you must sign in with your Google or GitHub account; make sure you use the same account when adding the Homebridge action in the Google Home mobile app.
Homebridge requires restarting for the changes to take effect.
plugins.settings.message_consult_documen: Please consult the plugin documentation for instructions on how to correctly configure this plugin.
plugins.settings.message_manual_config_r: This plugin must be configured manually using the Homebridge UI Config Editor.
plugins.settings.toast_restart_required: Restart Homebridge to apply the changes.
reset.accessories_will_may_need_to_be_re: After performing this action some accessories may need to be reconfigured in HomeKit or re-added to your automations.
reset.message_accessory_config_will_not_: The rest of your config will not be changed. If Homebridge is not starting due to a bad config a reset will not fix it.
reset.message_action_is_irreversible: This action is irreversible. Please read carefully before proceeding.
reset.message_all_automations_will_be_re: All automations and will need to be reconfigured after a reset.
reset.message_force_restart_hb_help_text: Use this action to force the hb-service service to do a full restart.
reset.message_need_to_remove_homebridge_: You will need to remove the existing Homebridge accessory from the Home app manually.
reset.message_remove_cached_accessories: This action will remove all cached accessories from your Homebridge instance.
reset.message_remove_cached_accessories_: Delete a single accessory from the accessory cache.
Use with caution. Removing certain cached accessories may have unintended consequences.
reset.message_reset_will_unpair_from_hom: A reset will unpair this Homebridge instance from your Apple HomeKit setup.
reset.message_unpair_bridges_cameras_tv_: This action allows you to unpair selected Bridges / Cameras / TVs or other external accessories.
reset.message_your_homebridge_username_w: Your Homebridge username and pin will be changed.
reset.title_unpair_bridges_cameras_tv_ex: Unpair Bridges / Cameras / TVs / External Accessories
reset.toast_clear_cached_accessories_suc: Restarting Homebridge and clearing accessory cache.
reset.toast_failed_to_reset: Failed to reset Homebridge. See Logs.
reset.toast_removing_cached_accessory_pl: Removing accessory from cache, please wait…
restart.message_please_wait_while_server: Please wait, this page will automatically redirect when Homebridge is back online.
restart.message_server_is_taking_long_ti: Homebridge restart is taking a long time. You may need to bring up the Homebridge service manually.
restart.toast_server_restart_error: An error occurred sending the restart command to the server
restart.toast_sever_restart_timeout: Homebridge is taking a long time to come back online
rpi.throttled.currently_undervoltage_mes: This Raspberry Pi is reporting it is currently under-voltage; please check it is connected to an appropriate power supply. Under-voltage can result in system instability and SD card corruption.
rpi.throttled.previously_undervoltage_me: This Raspberry Pi has reported an under-voltage event since it was last rebooted; please check it is connected to an appropriate power supply.
settings.manage_cache.help: If an accessory you no longer have is still being displayed in HomeKit, you may need to remove it from the cache. You can choose to remove a single accessory from the cache, or remove all cached accessories.
settings.mdns_advertiser_help: If you're having trouble connecting to Homebridge, try using one of the alternate mDNS advertisers.
settings.network.message_network_interfa: Select the network interfaces that Homebridge should advertise and listen on.
If no network interfaces are selected, Homebridge will attempt to automatically determine which interfaces to advertise.
settings.reset.help: If you are having trouble pairing Homebridge or an external accessory like a Camera or TV with HomeKit, you may need to unpair the accessory or reset your Homebridge instance.
setup_wizard.message_create_account_reas: Password authentication to your Homebridge admin web interface must be configured. Even if Homebridge is accessible only in your local network, it is still important to protect it from unrestricted access.
setup_wizard_message_complete_message: The setup procedure is complete and you're now ready to start using Homebridge.
status.widget.accessories.label_choose_a: Choose the Accessories to display in this widget from the Accessories tab.
status.widget.systeminfo.label_glibc_war: Version is too low for updating Node.js to newer versions - https://homebridge.io/w/JJSun
status.widget.systeminfo.modal_glibc_mes: This message indicates that your operating system does not support newer versions of Node.js. To resolve this and be able to install updated versions of Node.js in the future, you will need to update your operating system to a more recent version.
status.widget.systeminfo.modal_node_upda: Homebridge requires Node.js installed on your system to run. From time to time, you will need to update the Node.js runtime to enable support for new features. Homebridge (and verified plugins) support all current Active and Maintenance LTS releases of Node.js.
status.widget.systeminfo.modal_servicemo: Standalone mode is no longer recommended. Setting up Homebridge and Homebridge UI with hb-service has the same benefits of standalone mode but is much easier to setup and maintain.
status.widget.weather.label_add_city_ins: To enable the weather widget please search for your city name in English.
status.widget.weather.label_config_requi: Please select your city in the widget settings.
support.developers.title: Developers
support.title: Support
users.setup_2fa_disable_enter_current_pa: Enter your current password to disable two factor authentication:
users.setup_2fa_disable_success: Two factor authentication has been disabled.
users.setup_2fa_enabled_success: Two factor authentication has been enabled.
users.setup_2fa_enter_code: Enter the code from your authenticator app:
users.setup_2fa_scan_qr_code: Scan the QR code below with your authenticator app:
users.setup_2fa_server_time_out: Your server's clock is out by {{ timeDiffError }} ms. The maximum allowed is +/-5000 ms.
users.setup_2fa_warning: Two Factor Authentication requires your Homebridge server to have a very accurate date and time to login. If your server does not have the ability to keep time accurately you should not enable 2FA or risk being locked out of the Homebridge UI.
